metadata.case_name: Village Panchayat of Kanhan Pipri v. Brooke Bond of India Pvt. Ltd. & Ors.

facts.text: Village Panchayat of Kanhan Pipri originally constituted under C.P. Berar Panchayat Act, 1946; deemed Panchayat under Bombay Village Panchayat Act, 1958 effective June 1, 1959.
Panchayat passed Resolution No. 2 to levy minimum octroi duty on goods entering its limits as per Schedule I of Rules.
Resolution No. 5 passed accepting Resolution No. 2, directing compliance with Act and Rules including Octroi Rules, objections, decision on posts and places.
Public notice issued under r.3(b) of Maharashtra Village Panchayats Taxes and Fees Rules, 1960.
Brooke Bond of India Pvt. Ltd. (Company) preferred objections against proposed levy.
Resolution No. 3 passed considering objections, resolving to levy octroi on goods entering limits per Schedule I from April 1, 1963; final publication on March 1, 1963 by notice and beat of drum.
Resolution No. 3 passed fixing octroi limits, number of nakas and places.
Panchayat wrote to Collector, Nagpur seeking approval for octroi limits, nakas and places.
Panchayat started collecting octroi from April 1, 1963.
Company filed appeal under s.124(5) before Panchayat Samiti, Parseoni.
Panchayat Samiti rejected appeal as time-barred under r.5 of Fees Rules.
Decision communicated to Company on September 19, 1963.
Company filed appeal to Standing Committee, Zila Parishad, Nagpur.
Tehsildar Ramtek approved octroi limits, number and location of nakas under r.21.
Standing Committee allowed Company's appeal: (1) octroi limits needed Collector approval before levy under r.21; (2) Company not importing tea for consumption, use or sale.
Panchayat filed petition under Art.226 before Bombay High Court Nagpur Bench (Special Civil Application No. 355 of 1964) seeking to quash Standing Committee resolution and mandamus.
High Court dismissed petition: r.5 ultra vires; levy invalid for failure to fix limits per law; declined facts on tea.

legal_issues.text: Whether r.5 of Fees Rules is ultra vires.
Whether Standing Committee had jurisdiction to decide appeal on merits given time-bar by Panchayat Samiti.
Whether octroi duty levied in accordance with law, including procedure under rr.3,4,21,22.
Whether levy valid from January 14, 1964 after approval, and if approval relates back to April 1, 1963.
Whether Company imported tea into limits for consumption, use or sale therein.

petitioner_arguments.text: r.5 of Fees Rules is intra vires.
Standing Committee had no jurisdiction to decide appeal on merits as appeal to Panchayat Samiti barred by limitation.
Octroi duty levied in accordance with law; r.3(b) does not require fixing limits in initial resolution; procedure under rr.3,4 followed.
Levy good after octroi limits fixed on January 14, 1964; approval relates back to April 1, 1963.
Tea imported into Panchayat limits for consumption, use or sale.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.3(13) Bombay Village Panchayat Act; r.22 Fees Rules

respondent_arguments.text: Octroi limits needed approval under r.21 before levy.
Company not importing tea for consumption, use or sale within limits.

court_reasoning.text: Octroi levied validly following rr.3,4; r.21 approval is condition precedent but not required in r.3(a) resolution; levy effective from approval date Jan 14, 1964, no relation back.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Fixing octroi limits with Collector approval essential precondition to levy.

court_reasoning.text: r.5 valid, applies only to appeals against levy (post r.4 notice), not assessment/imposition; thus Samiti wrongly dismissed as time-barred, Standing Committee could hear on merits.
court_reasoning.key_observation: r.5 in context of rr.3,4 heading 'Appeal against levy'.

court_reasoning.text: Point on publication under r.4 not raised properly earlier, cannot be raised now.
Insufficient facts found by lower bodies on whether tea imported for consumption/use/sale; remand required.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Facts like processing, marketability not determined.

holdings.text: Octroi duty validly imposed per resolutions of Feb 25, 1963 and March 17, 1963 from January 14, 1964.
r.5 intra vires, applies to levy appeals; Samiti appeal not time-barred.
Remand to High Court to determine if Company imported tea for consumption, use or sale within limits.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Village Panchayat Act, 1958
statutes_cited.relevance: Empowers levy of octroi, appeals, rule-making; defines octroi.

statutes_cited.name: Maharashtra Village Panchayats Taxes and Fees Rules, 1960
statutes_cited.relevance: Procedure for levy, limits approval, limitation for appeals, rates.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; declared octroi validly leviable from January 14, 1964 per resolutions; r.5 valid; case remanded to High Court to decide if Company's tea imported for consumption/use/sale, either by remanding further or as deemed fit.
outcome.relief_granted: Declaration of valid levy from Jan 14, 1964; remand for factual issue.

key_quotes.text: "the fixing of the octroi limits with the approval of the Collector is an essential condition precedent to the levy of octroi duty."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "r.5 is dealing only with appeals against levy of any tax and not with the assessment or imposition of a tax"
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Interpretation upholding r.5 vires and scope.
